intro: Terniopsis australis, commonly known as the Australian terniopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Terniopsis australis typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
